title: Improve documentation for Pub/Sub and add split stream example
body: Thanks for implementing the split() method re: issue #57. I added some (hopefully helpful) documentation and improved the pub/sub documentation a little bit.

title: fix #56 [Bug] Credentials overwrite during sentinel connection
Fix skip offset calculation in connection info manager
body:
This PR adds a test case for a bug that I found (see https://github.com/dahomey-technologies/rustis/issues/61) and a fix for the underlying issue.

The bug is caused by calling skip() and then position() on an iterator without adding the number of skipped elements to the index. It looks like the start_from < 0 case was already handling this, but the >= 0 case wasn't.

title: Unrestrict response type of eval/fcall.
body: Script commands could return arbitrary data, not only primitives. In that sense they are somewhat similar to pipeline/transaction, so I've changed the return type from PrimitiveResponse to Response to unrestrict use-cases of scripting.

title: Parse NoScript error into it's own error type.
body: To use `evalsha` it necessary to handle no script error to perform script load in case of absent script, but there was no easy way to distinguish such error from other errors. So I've added special error kind to detect no script errors. @mcatanzariti could you please take a look?

title: Added missing SingleArgCollection for &[T: SingleArg].
body:
Hello @mcatanzariti !

I thinks these trait implementation were actually missing, which prevented slices of custom `SingleArg` implementers being passed directly to functions like `sadd`. Could you please review?

Thanks a lot in advace,
Yury.

title: Show exec/multi routed to a different nodes.
body:
This test show my naive assumption that transaction with the same-slot keys are correctly routed to particular node. The actual behavior is that `MULTI`, `..commands..` and `EXEC` can be routed to a different nodes leading to obscure response errors.
If transaction commands were routed to the same node redis cluster would handle them as transaction, if for any reason keys in commands batch form different nodes redis will fail `exec`:
```
127.0.0.1:6379> multi
OK
127.0.0.1:6379(TX)> get a
(error) MOVED 15495 10.70.0.12:6379
127.0.0.1:6379(TX)> get b
QUEUED
127.0.0.1:6379(TX)> get c
(error) MOVED 7365 10.70.0.11:6379
127.0.0.1:6379(TX)> get d
(error) MOVED 11298 10.70.0.12:6379
127.0.0.1:6379(TX)> get e
(error) MOVED 15363 10.70.0.12:6379
127.0.0.1:6379(TX)> exec
(error) EXECABORT Transaction discarded because of previous errors.
127.0.0.1:6379>
```
@mcatanzariti  do you think it make sense to add client side validation of keys in transaction batch and fail transaction on client side in case of a key slots are different in transaction batch? Or fix transaction batch routing by picking node by a first key slot in a transaction batch and let redis fail transaction in case of other keys are from a different nodes?

Thanks a lot in advance!

title: Add test to trigger busy-loop on Redis crash.
body:
Added test to trigger busy loop when one of the Redis nodes goes down. Tests disabled by default, because they causes Redis to go down.
Currently busy loop is stopped once command timeout exceeded and future is no longer polled, when there is no timeout busy loop is permanent.
This might be helpful to investigate the root-cause of #43.
I also continue investigation the origin of busy loop, but so far the is endless call to `next()` of completed framed TCP stream.

title: Updated backwards compatibility of docker commands
body: Depends on #41

title: Removed lifetime from transaction
body: `Transaction`s don't really require a lifetime anyway, since `Client` can be cloned easily. This would make the API surface simpler and make it easier to use a `Transaction` as a struct field, in order to pass it as state to functions

title: give modules a default value in hello command
body: without it, dragonflydb breaks as it doesn't send a modules field. this change shouldn't break any behavior with redis.

title: Support empty FT_SEARCH result
body: Currently, ft_search panics with `attempt to subtract with overflow` when the search has no results, and total_results is 0. This PR introduces an explicit check for a total_results value of 0 and returns an empty FtSearchResult in such cases.

title: Introduce NodeId. Make it cheap to copy.
body: There were expensive `String` clone from `Node` to `SubRequest` on each command handled by cluster connection. This could be avoided by sharing node id between `Node` and `SubRequest`, this expect to reduce memory traffic. I did not attempt to implement interning of node id's, but it could be done as further enhancement.

title: #31: Check pending requests completion before polling sockets.
#28: Test cluster connection with commands routed to different nodes.
#28: Log storing response into sub-request.
body: This log allow catching exact moment when sub-command result is being received making "whole" command to be fulfilled, but this not lead the command marked as completed and result is not immediately propagated into client application.

title: #28: Added unique sequence to messages and commands to facilitate logs inspection.
body:
I've found logs to be invaluable source of information when debugging strange timeouts (#28), but I need to know exactly which command & messages are not responded in time. So I propose adding additional fields to `Message` and `Command` structs in debug builds. These fields are easy to grep (thats why they have `message` and `command` in name), sequentially growing and unique across application run. I've also added trace-level logs to catch `Message` being enqueud, handled and responded. Also made it possible to override tests default log level via `RUST_LOG="rustis=trace" cargo test --release -- --nocapture`.
And I'd like to thank you @mcatanzariti for such a great library.

title: #28: Enrich network logs with connection tag ([name:]host:port).
body: During debugging the issue #28 in real application where multiple clients are used I've found it valuable to have network logs annotated with `connection_name`, `host` and `port` to understand the conditions where issue occur. In this MR I'm adding notion of `tag` which is something that is logged in each log message and by default is a combination of `connection_name:host:port` or `host:port`.

title: #28: Remove async from sync methods in ClusterConnection.
body: As a preparation to fix #28 it seems rational to reduce number of awaits in `ClusterConnection::read()` method to make code easier to understand when actual suspension of execution might take place.

title: Fix deserializing of negative numbers in response to memory stats.
body:
During `cargo test` I've got one test failure which tested response to `memory usage` command.
The failure was due to inability to de-serialize negative integer to `usize` field.
![выява](https://github.com/dahomey-technologies/rustis/assets/385639/65033b1a-412c-4c4c-906d-a98572ca50ea)

I can't find any robust documentation regarding the unsigned/signed types of values in response to `memory usage`. Except that according to [resp 3 specification](https://redis.io/docs/reference/protocol-spec/#resp-integers) the integer values are in range of signed 64-bit integers.

I've found out an existing issue regarding [negative memory](https://github.com/redis/redis/issues/5580) metric which was "fixed"  for specific scenario.

The struct holding memory metrics have some values stored as `size_t` and other as `ssize_t`:
https://github.com/redis/redis/blob/df1890ef7fc0691c0b940f00ddff14a1c395a52a/src/server.h#L1388C16-L1420

But the response is always written by (implicit?) conversion to `long long`:
https://github.com/redis/redis/blob/df1890ef7fc0691c0b940f00ddff14a1c395a52a/src/object.c#L1554-L1656

The computation where subtraction of `size_t` values leading to wrap around is happen here:
https://github.com/redis/redis/blob/df1890ef7fc0691c0b940f00ddff14a1c395a52a/src/object.c#L1172-L1187

So since there are 4 fields where subtraction with wrap around could happen I've decided to preemptively change types  to signed in `rustis`: 3 of them stored in redis code as `ssize_t` and one as `size_t`, but is serialized to negative value anyway.

title: Fixed typo in word Subscription.
add support for creating vector redisearch indices
body:
- Vector RediSearch indices require more information when being created, such as whether to use `FLAT` or `HNSW` and the dimensionality of the vector; I have extended the types to allow this
- In `<FtSearchResult as Deserialize<'_>>::visit_seq` I was getting panics due to overflow when `seq_size` was zero, so I rearranged the code to avoid this. I'm not really sure why `seq_size` would be zero, but it seems to work fine this way

title: Indicate minimum redis version for cluster support
body:
It is not currently indicated that to implement cluster support [`CLUSTER SHARDS`](https://redis.io/commands/cluster-shards/) is used, which is only available on Redis 7.0 and newer. Not sure if it's intentional final decision, but it's nice to have a clear indication in advance.
Extra question: would PR with support of [`CLUSTER SLOTS`](https://redis.io/commands/cluster-slots/) be possibly accepted to make cluster support works on earlier versions of Redis?

title: Fix documentation of get command.
Refactored IntoArgs & CommandArgs
Serde
Serde
